Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
The ALL Relapse GWAS dataset used for the analyses described in this manuscript were obtained from dbGaP at phs000638.v1.p1.
The ALL Relapse GWAS dataset was generated at St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital and by the Children’s Oncology Group, supported by NIH grants CA142665, CA21765, CA158568, CA156449, CA36401, CA98543, CA114766, CA140729, and U01GM92666, Jeffrey Pride Foundation, the National Childhood Cancer Foundation, and by ALSAC.
In addition, all authors should cite these papers describing generation of the data:
Yang JJ, Cheng C, Devidas M, Cao X, Fan Y, Campana D, Yang W, Neale G, Cox NJ, Scheet P, Borowitz MJ, Winick NJ, Martin PL, Willman CL, Bowman WP, Camitta BM, Carroll A, Reaman GH, Carroll WL, Loh M, Hunger SP, Pui CH, Evans WE, Relling MV. Nat Genet. 2011 Mar;43(3):237-41. Epub 2011 Feb 6..PMID21297632
Yang JJ, Cheng C, Devidas M, Cao X, Campana D, Yang W, Fan Y, Neale G, Cox N, Scheet P, Borowitz MJ, Winick NJ, Martin PL, Bowman P, Camitta B, Reaman GH, Carroll WL, Willman CL, Hunger SP, Evans WE, Pui CH, Loh M, Relling MV. Genome-wide association study identifies germline polymorphisms associated with relapse of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia. Blood 120:4197-204, 2012. PMID:23007406

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical
ConsentGroup.name: HMB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry.
